title: Drawing, "Project for a sedan chair", 1770–75
medium: Pen and ink, brush and various watercolors on paper
inscribed: The signature and something in the front foot have been erased.
creditline: Gift of Mrs. Charles B. Alexander
description: Shown from the rear right corner with two bars.  A proof with a scroll on top.  Its triangular panels are framed by garlands and decorated with rays.  Tassels hang at the corners.  The panels beside that with the window and at the back are divided in quadrangles above and in oblongs below, as one is below the window.  All compartments are framed by garlands.  Festoons hand above in the quadrangles.  In that of the back they frame the monogram A B below.  The bars are decorated in the width of the chair.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Project for a sedan chair", 1770–75.
1770–75. Pen and ink, brush and various watercolors on paper. Gift of Mrs. Charles B. Alexander. 1900-1-19.
